# Copilot Instructions for Games Repository

## Repository Overview

This is a games repository intended for storing game-related projects and code.

## Code Style and Conventions

- Follow the conventions of the language being used (Python, JavaScript, Java, etc.)
- Use clear, descriptive variable and function names
- Add comments to explain complex game logic or algorithms
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

## Project Structure

- Each game should be in its own directory
- Include a README.md for each game explaining how to run it
- Include any necessary configuration files
- Separate source code from assets (images, sounds, etc.)

## Testing

- Write unit tests for game logic where applicable
- Test edge cases and boundary conditions
- Ensure games work across different platforms if applicable

## Documentation

- Document game controls and mechanics
- Include setup and installation instructions
- Explain any dependencies or requirements
- Add screenshots or demos where helpful

## Best Practices

- Keep games modular and maintainable
- Use version control effectively with clear commit messages
- Handle errors gracefully
- Consider performance optimization for game loops and rendering
